course.title: Media, Public Opinion and Foreign Policy
course.description: This course investigates the means through which the media and public opinion influence U.S. foreign policy. We will consider how the public learns about foreign policy, whether and when they care about it, and when political leaders will be responsive to public preferences. We will also consider the effects of real-time global news reporting and media fragmentation. The goal is to understand the interaction between the media, the public and political leaders.
